title: Wheelchair Tennis Star Loses Big Match
summary: Alfie Hewett is a famous wheelchair tennis player from Britain who won the Australian Open tournament in 2023 and 2025. In this year's Australian Open, he tried to defend his title but lost in the semi-finals to Martin de la Puente from Spain. The match score was 6-4, 6-4, and it took about an hour and a half. Hewett also lost in the men's doubles semi-finals earlier with his partner Gordon Reid. Another British player, Andy Lapthorne, lost in the quad doubles final while trying to defend his title. The article talks about these matches and what happened to these athletes in the tournament.

background_read: Wheelchair tennis is a sport for athletes who use wheelchairs, played on the same courts as regular tennis. The Australian Open is one of the four Grand Slam tournaments, which are the most important events in tennis. Players from around the world compete to win titles, and defending a title means trying to win it again after winning it before. Matches can be in singles (one player vs. another) or doubles (two players vs. two others). This article is about some British players who lost their matches in the Australian Open wheelchair events.
